definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The present art director is the well-known conductor Cao Peng.
sentences.chinese: 目前，乐团由著名指挥家曹鹏任艺术总监。

sentences.english: The song was created by Jin Chenzhi, a young composer and conductor.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌由年轻的作曲家和指挥家金承志创作。

sentences.english: Young conductors earn their spurs in a small orchestra or opera house.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的指挥家们在小乐队或小歌剧院里崭露头角。

sentences.english: Who would you name as the greatest conductor of your time?
sentences.chinese: 你认为谁是你那时代最伟大的指挥家？

sentences.english: In 1899, musical conductor Eugene Ormandy was born in Budapest, Hungary.
sentences.chinese: 1899年，音乐指挥家尤金匈牙利布达佩斯出生。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
